latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

bill.title: To direct the United States Postal Service to designate a single, unique ZIP Code for Glendale, New York.
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 17 (Wednesday, February 1, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. MENG:H.R. 803.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution.[Page H878]

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text: This bill directs the U.S. Postal Service, not later than 180 days after its enactment, to designate a single, unique ZIP code applicable to the area encompassing only Glendale, New York.

item.title: To direct the United States Postal Service to designate a single, unique ZIP Code for Glendale, New York.
To direct the United States Postal Service to designate a single, unique ZIP Code for Glendale, New York.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
